page.title: 14CHANGE IN INCE, WIGAN
page.content: {INDUSTRY} - Ince has changed; its old heavy industrial backdrop of factories and long ribbons of terraced housing has gone. Smaller industries, light engineering particularly,now dominate. Gullick-Dobson remains the world leader in making mining supports. {HOUSING } - In 1985 Ince's environment is more pleasant with green areas covering once derelict land. The houses are semi-detached or modern "town" style with small gardens. {TRANSPORT}- There are regular bus routes and a railway station on the Manchester-Wigan-Southport line. Our survey showed that Manchester Road should be a 4-lane carriageway instead of 2-lane given the volume of traffic. {SHOPPING} - This has changed too, from small corner shops to supermarkets. The new Smithy Green precinct should attract new trade to the town centre.
